result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine M Thomas

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Jeff Jensen, Jr. advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
Judgment of Bail/Bond Forfeiture and Judgment/Notice of Entry of Judgment for the defendant returned.  Return to sender, no such number, unable to forward.
09:45 AM Defendant Jermaine M Thomas not in court.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Jeffrey Jensen appearing in court.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen.
Preliminary hearing on March 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key, with the exception of contact in the event of an emergency and if Victim A initiates contact.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

02:42 PM Defendant Jermaine M Thomas in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Initial appearance on February 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:29 PM Defendant Jermaine M Thomas in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and Court reads complaint to the defendant.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  1:33 Jermaine Thomas removed from the courtroom.  Atty. Hughes states defendant refused to meet with the representative from the public defender's office.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
